Class Levels

java.lang.Object
Levels
public class Levels extends Object
This Levels class handles the layout of the maps inside the game. It currently has 3 levels and it is used by the Display class to show the map layouts and it is the one to show the tile characters, hazard(water/fire) tiles, doors, force tiles, collectibles, and exit tile.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Levels(char[][] map, int chips)
    Constructor of Levels class that accepts the given map and chips required to pass the level/map

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static Levels
    generateMap1()
    Current layout for the first map, it is a beginner and teaching level as it only features keys and door tiles Currently has a red key, red door, blue key, blue door, and 4 chips to collect to pass the level
    static Levels
    generateMap2()
    Current layout for the second map, it is a normal level as it features hazard and force tiles Currently has force tiles, flippers, water tiles, fire boots, fire tiles, and 4 chips to pass the level
    static Levels
    generateMap3()
    Current layout for the third map, it is a combination of difficulty for past levels as it features both hazard and force tiles and key and door tiles This map currently has force tiles, flippers, water tiles, fire boots, fire tiles, red key, red door, blue key, blue door and 5 chips to pass the level
    int
    getChips()
    Returns the chips required for the map being used
    char[][]
    getMap()
    Returns the map layout being used

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Levels

      public Levels(char[][] map, int chips)
      Constructor of Levels class that accepts the given map and chips required to pass the level/map
      Parameters:
      map - - 2d array for the map layout
      chips - - required chips to pass a single level

  • Method Details

    • generateMap1

      public static Levels generateMap1()
      Current layout for the first map, it is a beginner and teaching level as it only features keys and door tiles Currently has a red key, red door, blue key, blue door, and 4 chips to collect to pass the level
      Returns:
      Levels- it returns the current map layout for level 1 for the Display class to use

    • generateMap2

      public static Levels generateMap2()
      Current layout for the second map, it is a normal level as it features hazard and force tiles Currently has force tiles, flippers, water tiles, fire boots, fire tiles, and 4 chips to pass the level
      Returns:
      Levels - returns the current map layout for level 2 for the Display class to use

    • generateMap3

      public static Levels generateMap3()
      Current layout for the third map, it is a combination of difficulty for past levels as it features both hazard and force tiles and key and door tiles This map currently has force tiles, flippers, water tiles, fire boots, fire tiles, red key, red door, blue key, blue door and 5 chips to pass the level
      Returns:
      Levels- returns the current map layout for level 3 for the Display class to use

    • getMap

      public char[][] getMap()
      Returns the map layout being used
      Returns:
      map - the map layout being used

    • getChips

      public int getChips()
      Returns the chips required for the map being used
      Returns:
      chips - the chips required to pass the current map level
